value.title: DAX Fridays! #118: Get selected or multiple values from slicers using DAX
value.excerpt: In today's #daxfridays video I will show you how to get selected or multiple values from a slicer.  To do that, we will use the following functiions: 1. SELECTEDVALUE: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/selectedvalue-dax 2. ALLSELECTED: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/allselected-dax 3. IN: https://curbal.com/blog/glossary/in-dax

value.title: DAX Fridays! #41: LOOKUPVALUE with multiple columns

We will have two scenarios,: Scenario 1: we will do a lookupvalue with two

value.title: Get only the rows you need in Power Query from your files.
value.excerpt: In today's video I will show you how to find the rows you need and import those instead of importing everything and then filtering them. value.title: Can you refresh a single table in Power BI?
value.excerpt: Frustrated that a you can only do a full refresh? Patrick takes it to the next level by showing how you can refresh only a single table in your Power BI dataset. This is a great option for targeted refresh and avoid potential overhead. value.title: DAX! Uggg - Where do you start? | Power BI
